string.name: wp_medications_activity_title
string.context: The title for the medications activity, displayed in the navigation bar at the top of the view

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_medication_detail_label
string.context: Details label for an encounter specific medication. Not all parameters may be populated, especially the brand name. %1$@ - The medication dose, in digits, %2$@ - The dose units, %3$@ - The medication route. E.g. by mouth, %4$@ - The medication frequency. E.g. 3 times daily

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_linked_medication_or_label
string.context: Label shown above a linked medication group that has an OR relationship between the meds. See https://wiki.epic.com/main/Orders/Composer_%26_Validation/Linked_Orders

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_linked_medication_and_label
string.context: Label shown above a linked medication group that has an AND relationship between the meds. See https://wiki.epic.com/main/Orders/Composer_%26_Validation/Linked_Orders

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_prn_only_header_label
string.context: Label shown in the hospital medications activity in the section header for PRN medications, if there are no standard medications

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_prn_header_label
string.context: Label shown in the hospital medications activity in the section header for PRN medications. There is a leading 'and' because this displays in the section header after standard medications. Not a part of a compound string.

string.name: wp_medications_filter_meds_label
string.context: Warning that appears in the medications activity, if some of the medications may have been filtered from the activity

resources.string: Les médicaments confidentiels ne sont pas affichés ici. Ce message apparaîtra même s\'il n\'y en a pas dans le dossier.

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_no_meds_label
string.context: Label that displays in the hospital medications activity if there are no medications to show

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_no_meds_label_proxy
string.context: Label that displays in the hospital medications activity if there are no medications to show, if viewing as a proxy

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_administer_warning_label
string.context: Label that displays in the bottom banner of the hospital medications activity, warning the user not to self-administer medications

resources.string: Votre équipe soignante fournira ces médicaments.

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_administer_warning_label_proxy
string.context: Label that displays in the bottom banner of the hospital medications activity, warning the user not to administer the proxy's medications

resources.string: L\'équipe soignante de %1$@ fournira ces médicaments.

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_confidential_meds_all
string.context: Header that indicates that a medication is hidden from all proxies

resources.string: Masqué pour la famille et les amis

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_confidential_meds_hidden_from_one_proxy
string.context: Label that indicates that medications are hidden from 1 proxy. %1$@ = proxy's name.

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_confidential_meds_hidden_from_two_proxies
string.context: Label that indicates that medications are hidden from 2 proxies. %1$@ = proxy 1's name. %2$@ = proxy 2's name.

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_confidential_meds_hidden_from_more_than_two_proxies
string.context: Label that indicates that medications are hidden from more than 2 proxies. %1$@ = proxy 1's name. %2$@ = the number of proxies who cannot view hidden test results less one.

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_confidential_meds_dialog_header
string.context: Header for the list of proxies that the medications may be hidden from

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_confidential_meds_hidden
string.context: Accessibility label that will be applied when a medication is hidden

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_linked_medication_accessibility
string.context: Accessibility content that indicates that medication is in the list of linked medication. %1$@ = the current medication position in the list. %2$@ = the total number of linked medication.

string.name: wp_medications_upcoming_meds_header
string.context: Header for the list of medications that are upcoming and scheduled (not as needed)

string.name: wp_medications_as_needed_meds_header
string.context: Header for the list of medications that may be given as needed (PRN)

string.name: wp_medications_given_meds_header
string.context: Header for the list of medications that have been given

string.name: wp_medications_additional_given_meds_button_title
string.context: Title for the button to expand or collapse the given medications section. %1$@ = the number of meds that will be shown or hidden upon tapping the button.

string.name: wp_medications_encounterspecific_no_upcoming_meds
string.context: Text that will appear under the upcoming header if we have some PRN or given medications, but no medications in the upcoming section

resources.string: Il n\'y a aucun médicament à venir planifié
